gameplay.gameboard

Class Tile

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.Node
      • javafx.scene.Parent
        • javafx.scene.layout.Region
          • javafx.scene.layout.Pane
            • javafx.scene.layout.StackPane
              • gameplay.gameboard.Tile
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget

    public class Tile
extends javafx.scene.layout.StackPane
    Creates a Tile to be put inside a Grid. The tile can hold units or obstacles. Tile is set up with a position in Grid, and has a static position. Each tile has a Rectangle that can set a Image if there is a unit or obstacle in it. Tile extends to a StackPane, which will center the tile in a fixed position and works in accordance with Grid.
    See Also:
    Grid, Unit, Obstacle, StackPane

    • Constructor Detail

      • Tile

        public Tile(int sizeX,
            int sizeY)
        Sets the size and shape of a tile, and places a image in the tile for use with the Placement phase, it uses DragBoard for this. It also sets stroke size, type, width and color the tile.
        Parameters:
        sizeX - Takes a integer to set the tiles length.
        sizeY - Takes a integer to set the tiles height.
        See Also:
        Dragboard, Unit, Obstacle

    • Method Detail

      • setUnit

        public void setUnit(Unit unit)
        Sets a unit in the tile, it is used if a player moved the unit on top of the tile.
        Parameters:
        unit - Takes in a unit to be placed on the tile.
        See Also:
        Unit

      • getUnit

        public Unit getUnit()
        Returns a Unit if it is set. Else it returns null. It is used to get information about whether the Tile holds a Unit or not.
        Returns:
        Unit Returns a unit, if a unit is set on the tile, else returns null.
        See Also:
        Unit

      • removeUnit

        public void removeUnit()
        Removes a unit from the tile's StackPane and sets the unit=null;
        See Also:
        Unit, StackPane

      • getObstacle

        public Obstacle getObstacle()
        Returns a Obstacle if it is set. Else it returns null. It is used to get information about whether the Tile holds a Obstacle or not.
        Returns:
        Obstacle Returns the obstacle if set, else returns null;
        See Also:
        Obstacle

      • setObstacle

        public void setObstacle(Obstacle obstacle)
        Sets a Obstacle in the tile.
        Parameters:
        obstacle - Takes in a obstacle to be placed on the tile.
        See Also:
        Obstacle

      • setUntargetable

        public void setUntargetable()
        Is used to set any tile untargetable for Dragboard either when a unit is already placed on the tile, or if the tile is in the non-targetable zone at the start of the placement phase
        See Also:
        Dragboard, GameMain

      • setTargetable

        public void setTargetable()
        Is used to set tile targetable again if the unit is sold during the placementphase.
        See Also:
        GameMain

      • setFill

        public void setFill(javafx.scene.paint.Paint color)
        Sets the fill color for the tile.
        Parameters:
        color - Takes Paint class as parameter for which color to paint tile.
        See Also:
        Rectangle, Paint

      • setStroke

        public void setStroke(javafx.scene.paint.Paint color)
        Sets the stroke color for the tile.
        Parameters:
        color - Takes Paint class as parameter for which color to have as stroke around Tile.
        See Also:
        Rectangle, Paint

      • setStrokeType

        public void setStrokeType(javafx.scene.shape.StrokeType value)
        Sets the stroke type for the tile.
        Parameters:
        value - Takes StrokeType class as parameter for which type of stroke to have around Tile.
        See Also:
        Rectangle, StrokeType

      • setStrokeWidth

        public void setStrokeWidth(double value)
        Sets the stroke width for the tile.
        Parameters:
        value - Takes a double value for the stroke width.
        See Also:
        Rectangle, Stroke
